creator: hans.schmid@einsurance.de
text:
Just a very minor glitch in bin/tomcat.bat

It still says Tomcat 3.3 instead 3.3.1

--- tomcat.bat.orig	Wed Mar 27 16:19:22 2002
+++ tomcat.bat	Wed Mar 27 16:13:09 2002
@@ -86,8 +86,8 @@
 rem ----- Prepare Appropriate Java Execution Commands -----------------------
 
 if not "%OS%" == "Windows_NT" goto noTitle
-set _SECSTARTJAVA=start "Secure Tomcat 3.3" "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
-set _STARTJAVA=start "Tomcat 3.3" "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
+set _SECSTARTJAVA=start "Secure Tomcat 3.3.1" "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
+set _STARTJAVA=start "Tomcat 3.3.1" "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
 set _RUNJAVA="%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
 goto setClasspath

creator: hans.schmid@einsurance.de
text:
Created attachment 1435
fix for tomcat.bat version number

This seems to be fixed already (in a better way than I proposed)
Look into shell/tomcat.bat:

rem ----- Prepare Appropriate Java Execution Commands -----------------------

if not "%OS%" == "Windows_NT" goto noTitle
set _SECSTARTJAVA=start "Secure @TITLE@" "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
set _STARTJAVA=start "@TITLE@" "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
set _RUNJAVA="%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java"
goto setClasspath

Title gets set now during the Build process

so it can go into the RELEASENOTES-3.3.2.txt

Can anybody confirm this?

Thanks,
Hans
creator: hans.schmid@einsurance.de
